pullRequest.title: Helm3 crds
pullRequest.bodyText:
Type of change
Enhancement / new feature
Description
Move Helm 3 chart CRDs to the crds directory (#3203)
Helm charts can have dependencies on other Helm charts. When a
dependent chart has CRDs that need to be installed and the parent
chart is installing CRs using those CRDs, ordering becomes
important. In Helm 3 this ordering is handled by placing the CRDs
in a special crds directory. Helm will always install these CRDs
first.
By moving the CRDs to the crds directory, charts can include
Strimzi as a dependency without ordering issues related to
installing CRDs.
Checklist

 Update/write design documentation in ./design
 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass
 Update documentation
 Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Reference relevant issue(s) and close them after merging
 Update CHANGELOG.md

nodes.bodyText: This appears unused in both _helpers.tpl so I went ahead and cleaned it up. This is split into a separate commit and I can remove it if we don't want this change.
imageRepositoryOverride and imageTagOverride are used in the chart but not present in the values.yaml. This was added to both charts for reference.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -117,7 +116,7 @@ readinessProbe:
   periodSeconds: 30
 
 # Override the docker image repository used by all Strimzi images
-# imageRepositoryOverride: foobar
+imageRepositoryOverride: ""

nodes.bodyText: All templating is removed from the CRDs as templates are not support in the crds directory for Helm 3.
Since the CRDs no longer contain templates, we're able to remove several usages of yq to modify the yml.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,32 +38,26 @@ crd_install_helm2:
 crd_install_helm3:
 	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/043-Crd-kafkatopic.yaml ./topic-operator/04-Crd-kafkatopic.yaml
 	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/044-Crd-kafkauser.yaml ./user-operator/04-Crd-kafkauser.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/040-Crd-kafka.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/040-Crd-kafka.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/041-Crd-kafkaconnect.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/041-Crd-kafkaconnect.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/042-Crd-kafkaconnects2i.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/042-Crd-kafkaconnects2i.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/043-Crd-kafkatopic.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/043-Crd-kafkatopic.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/044-Crd-kafkauser.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/044-Crd-kafkauser.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/045-Crd-kafkamirrormaker.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/045-Crd-kafkamirrormaker.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/046-Crd-kafkabridge.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/046-Crd-kafkabridge.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/047-Crd-kafkaconnector.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/047-Crd-kafkaconnector.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/048-Crd-kafkamirrormaker2.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/048-Crd-kafkamirrormaker2.yaml
-	$(CP) ./cluster-operator/049-Crd-kafkarebalance.yaml ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/049-Crd-kafkarebalance.yaml
-	oldpath=`pwd` && cd ../helm-charts/helm3/strimzi-kafka-operator/templates/ &&  $(FIND) . -type f -name '04*-Crd-*.yaml' -exec yq write -i {} metadata.labels.app "{{ template \"strimzi.name\" . }}" \; && cd $$oldpath

beforeCommit.message:
Move Helm 3 chart CRDs to the crds directory (#3203)

Helm charts can have dependencies on other Helm charts. When a
dependent chart has CRDs that need to be installed and the parent
chart is installing CRs using those CRDs, ordering becomes
important. In Helm 3 this ordering is handled by placing the CRDs
in a special crds directory. Helm will always install these CRDs
first.

By moving the CRDs to the crds directory, charts can include
Strimzi as a dependency without ordering issues related to
installing CRDs.

By moving the CRDs to the crds directory, charts can include
Strimzi as a dependency without ordering issues related to
installing CRDs.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: I think the app label is fairly useful to find all resources belonging to the app ... I wonder if we should find a way to add it back. But not sure what the options are if the templates are not supported here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,15 +1,10 @@
-{{- if .Values.createGlobalResources -}}
 apiVersion: apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1
 kind: CustomResourceDefinition
 metadata:
   name: kafkas.kafka.strimzi.io
   labels:
-    app: '{{ template "strimzi.name" . }}'

nodes.bodyText: The build was failing for me locally with JDK 14 due to more strict ordering for headers in Javadoc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -63,7 +63,7 @@ *

The tool works by recursing through class properties (in the JavaBeans sense) * and the types of those properties, guided by the annotations.

* - *

Annotations

+ *

Annotations

commit.message:
Add used but missing values to chart values.yaml

imageRepositoryOverride and imageTagOverride are used but do not exist
the the values.yaml for the charts. Adding them with a default value of
an empty string preserves existing behavior but makes the values more
visible to user when referencing the values.yaml.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>

Remove unused Helm template in _helpers.tpl

Removing the dockerRegistryOverride from _helpers.tpl for both charts as this
value is unused. The imageRepositoryOverride template appears to serve the
same purpose and is used in the charts.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>

Move Helm 3 chart CRDs to the crds directory (#3203)

Helm charts can have dependencies on other Helm charts. When a
dependent chart has CRDs that need to be installed and the parent
chart is installing CRs using those CRDs, ordering becomes
important. In Helm 3 this ordering is handled by placing the CRDs
in a special crds directory. Helm will always install these CRDs
first.

By moving the CRDs to the crds directory, charts can include
Strimzi as a dependency without ordering issues related to
installing CRDs.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>

Fix Javadoc header ordering

When building with JDK 14, the build fails with an error due to stricter Javadoc
rules added in JDK 13.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>

Fix missing trailing slash in multi-line command

The script echoed by the build script when there are uncommitted changes to
generator or derived resources was missing a trailing slash causing the
command to fail when copying and pasting the command.

Signed-off-by: Michael Barker <michael.barker.84@gmail.com>
